topic: How to combine bisect with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine bisect with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining Bisect and Typing for Production-Ready Code in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: Learn how to leverage the power of the bisect module along with type hints for writing efficient, maintainable, and production-ready code in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand when and why to use bisect
Explore the benefits of using type hinting
Implement best practices for combining bisect and typing in your codebase
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for accessing the insort_right function.
Type hints were introduced in Python 3.5, but their usage has become more widespread and important with later versions.
caveats: Using bisect can have a performance impact on lists with many duplicate elements due to the sorting operation involved.
Always ensure that type hints are used consistently across your codebase for maximum benefit and readability.
